ratings.description: With incapacitating episodes having a total duration of at least 6 weeks during the past 12 months

notes.note: General Rating Formula for Diagnostic Codes 6000 through 6009
Evaluate on the basis of either visual impairment due to the particular condition or on incapacitating episodes, whichever results in a higher evaluation.
Note: For VA purposes, an incapacitating episode is a period of acute symptoms severe enough to require prescribed bed rest and treatment by a physician or other healthcare provider.

ratings.description: Localized scars, atrophy, or irregularities of the retina, unilateral or bilateral, that are centrally located and that result in an irregular, duplicated, enlarged, or diminished image

see_other_notes.see_other_note: Alternatively, evaluate based on visual impairment due to retinal scars, atrophy, or irregularities, if this would result in a higher evaluation.

Minimum evaluation if continuous medication is required

notes.note: Evaluate on the basis of either visual impairment due to angle-closure glaucoma or incapacitating episodes, whichever results in a higher evaluation.
Note: For VA purposes, an incapacitating episode is a period of acute symptoms severe enough to require prescribed bed rest and treatment by a physician or other healthcare provider.

ratings.description: Minimum evaluation if continuous medication is required

see_other_notes.see_other_note: Evaluate based on visual impairment due to open-angle glaucoma.

ratings.description: Malignant neoplasm of the eyeball that requires therapy that is comparable to that used for systemic malignancies,

notes.note: Note: Continue the 100-percent rating beyond the cessation of any surgical, X-ray, antineoplastic chemotherapy or other therapeutic procedure. Six months after discontinuance of such treatment, the appropriate disability rating will be determined by mandatory VA examination. Any change in evaluation based upon that or any subsequent examination will be subject to the provisions of § 3.105(e) of this chapter. If there has been no local recurrence or metastasis, evaluate based on residuals.
Malignant neoplasm of the eyeball that does not require therapy comparable to that for systemic malignancies:
Separately evaluate visual impairment and nonvisual impairment, e.g., disfigurement (diagnostic code 7800), and combine the evaluations.
Separately evaluate visual impairment and nonvisual impairment, e.g., disfigurement (diagnostic code 7800), and combine the evaluations.

ratings.description: Active: Evaluate based on visual impairment, minimum

see_other_notes.see_other_note: Inactive: Evaluate based on residuals, such as visual impairment and disfigurement (diagnostic code 7800).

ratings.description: Active (with objective findings, such as red, thick conjunctivae, mucous secretion, etc.)

see_other_notes.see_other_note: Inactive: Evaluate based on residuals, such as visual impairment and disfigurement (diagnostic code 7800).
Evaluate based on visual impairment or, in the absence of visual impairment, on disfigurement (diagnostic code 7800).

code.description: Disorders of the lacrimal apparatus (epiphora, dacryocystitis, etc.):

see_other_notes.see_other_note: If a replacement lens is present (pseudophakia), evaluate based on visual impairment. If there is no replacement lens, evaluate based on aphakia.

notes.note: Preoperative:
Postoperative:

code.description: Aphakia or dislocation of crystalline lens:

see_other_notes.see_other_note: Evaluate based on visual impairment, and elevate the resulting level of visual impairment one step.

code.description:

ratings.description: 6030 Paralysis of accommodation (due to neuropathy of the Oculomotor Nerve (cranial nerve III)).

code.description: Loss of eyelids, partial or complete:

notes.note: Separately evaluate both visual impairment due to eyelid loss and nonvisual impairment, e.g., disfigurement (diagnostic code 7800), and combine the evaluations.

see_other_notes.see_other_note: Evaluate based on visual impairment, disfigurement (diagnostic code 7800), conjunctivitis (diagnostic code 6018), etc., depending on the particular findings.
Evaluate based on impairment of visual acuity.

ratings.description: Minimum, if there is pain, photophobia, and glare sensitivity
